alert.note: Alert for Ashland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 7:18PM EST until February 19 at 8:30PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by recent rainfall and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Southern Ashland County in north central Ohio. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 718 PM EST, Recent rainfall and snowmelt are causing flooding, especially along the Black Fork in Loudonville. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Loudonville and Mifflin.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
